barcodeFilterNode¶

The BarcodeFilterNode simply filters barcode topics by certain filters.

Actions are simple functions that return True or False depending on if the barcode fulfills or not the filter. Be careful with the ordering of the filter_actions parameter as the filters are tested in order and this may affect the outcome.

Note

This node was made to easily add new filtering functions. To make a new one simple make sure it returns a bool. Also, because of this the paramenters used can be increased. It is important that the function name and the string in the filter_actions are the same.

Sometimes the image_to_barcode_node has been seen to publish “/a” characters. Using this barcode_filter_node can help filter that type of weird publishing.

ROS Parameters:

filter_actions (list of strings): list of filter actions to be done

length filter:

min_length (int): minimum length of barcode.raw_data

max_length (int): maximum length of barcode.raw_data

contains filter:

contains_string (string): string that barcode.raw_data should have

Subscribes:
barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode): the barcode found in the image. If more than

one barcode is present, it publishes them in separate messages.

Publishes:

filtered_barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode): the same barcode as subscribed. Only publishes if all filters are passed.

class scripts.barcode_filter_node.BarcodeFilterNode[source]¶

ROS Node to filter barcode topics in different ways

contains(barcode)[source]¶

Filter function. Checks that barcode.raw_data contains the contains_string.

Parameters

barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode) – a barcode

Returns

bool. True if filter is passed.

length(barcode)[source]¶

Filter function. Checks that the barcode.raw_data’s length is between min and max length.

Parameters

barcode (umd_msgs/Barcode) – a barcode

Returns

bool. True if filter is passed.

barcode_reader
